title: Chronozon

properties.value: Chronozon is a blood demon that must be defeated towards the end of the Family Crest quest. It is found in the Wilderness area of the Edgeville Dungeon, by the Earth obelisk. Chronozon must be hit with all four elemental blast spells in order to be killed, or otherwise it will return to full health when it is nearly dead. Players should note that Chronozon has to be hit (i.e. do actual damage: if the spell splashes, it will not count). It will not drop the crest part unless the player has completed most of the quest. He can be fought in the Nightmare Zone after the quest is complete.

Chronozon is a blood demon that must be defeated towards the end of the Family Crest quest. It is found in the Wilderness area of the Edgeville Dungeon, by the Earth obelisk. Chronozon must be hit with all four elemental blast spells in order to be killed, or otherwise it will return to full health when it is nearly dead. Players should note that Chronozon has to be hit (i.e. do actual damage: if the spell splashes, it will not count). It will not drop the crest part unless the player has completed most of the quest. He can be fought in the Nightmare Zone after the quest is complete.

Contents

  • 1 Location
  • 2 Killing Chronozon
  • 3 Drops
    • 3.1 100%
    • 3.2 Tertiary
  • 4 Changes
    • 4.1 Gallery (historical)
  • 5 Trivia

Location[edit | edit source]

Location Levels Members Spawns Map
Edgeville Dungeon (Wilderness)1701Maplink

Killing Chronozon[edit | edit source]

It is recommended to bring any method of curing poison before encountering Chronozon, because players will have to pass an area filled with poison spiders that may attack you before you reach Chronozon. Chronozon is unique in that it has to be hit with each of the 4 elemental blast spells, Wind Blast, Water Blast, Earth Blast and Fire Blast. A message will appear in the chatbox, saying "Chronozon weakens" to confirm that the spell has been made effective. Once all 4 elemental spells have been cast on Chronozon, players may do as they wish to dispatch of him. Since he only uses Melee, continuing to mage him or ranging him is an easy way to finish him off, as there is a safespot in the area. However, Melee can also be used.

Once defeated, it will instantly drop the Crest part onto the floor.

Drops[edit | edit source]

100%[edit | edit source]

Item Quantity Rarity Price High Alch
Vile ashes1Always5810
Crest part (Johnathon)1Always[d 1]Not soldN/A
  1. ^ Crest parts are only dropped during Family Crest.

Item Quantity Rarity Price High Alch
Looting bag11/3Not soldN/A

Changes[edit | edit source]

Date Changes
16 June 2021
(update | poll)

Chronozon now drops vile ashes in place of regular ashes.

Gallery (historical)[edit | edit source]
29 March 2004 –
29 August 2006 		29 August 2006 –
present

Trivia[edit | edit source]

  • Chronozon's name is likely based on Choronzon, an abyss-dwelling demon of dispersion that Edward Kelley, John Dee, and Aleister Crowley wrote about.
  • When the quest was first released, Chronozon was located in the Lava Maze Dungeon. Due to player complaints about being killed, he was moved to Edgeville Dungeon the next day.
